meanings.definition: Capable of being trafficked or traveled on.
meanings.sent1: The road was trafficable, allowing cars to pass through easily.
meanings.sent2: The trafficable bridge was sturdy and safe for pedestrians.
meanings.sent3: The trafficable path through the forest made the hike enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like a trafficable route, guiding people towards her warmth.
meanings.sent5: The trafficable runway welcomed planes from all over the world.

meanings.definition: Suitable for or used in traffic.
meanings.sent1: The trafficable street was well-lit and wide for vehicles.
meanings.sent2: Trafficable signs helped drivers navigate the busy intersection.
meanings.sent3: The trafficable bus stop had a shelter for passengers waiting.
meanings.sent4: Her words were a trafficable bridge between the two conflicting parties.
meanings.sent5: The trafficable highway connected cities for efficient travel.

meanings.definition: Able to be bought or sold.
meanings.sent1: The trafficable goods were displayed attractively in the store.
meanings.sent2: The antique vase was trafficable at the auction house.
meanings.sent3: His idea was so trafficable that investors were eager to buy in.
meanings.sent4: Her talent was a trafficable commodity in the competitive industry.
meanings.sent5: The trafficable property was quickly sold to the highest bidder.
